title: Which songs from The Beatles White Album could have fit in on other Beatles albums and on which albums? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is very difficult to find any songs, after 66’ to fit on any earlier albums, or vice versa from The Beatles!! …. But one from the white album that could fit on any of the Beatles earlier albums is ……..”I will” by Paul. This song never got much attention, because it most likely sounded “dated” at the time and was strictly written by Paul. Which I don’t think the others, especially John, ever liked when one of them did this. I think it was a great song and if it was a few years earlier, there would’ve been harmonies added by John and maybe a little more of a solo by George and a little beat by Ringo!!! ….. this song could have been on any album from 63–65’ but I think more like “This is the Beatles, Beatles for sale or hard days night”. I think it definitely had more of an early sound to it.

Sgt. Pepper was so revolutionary as the album preceding The White Album (not counting the MMT extended play), that no other songs of The Beatles would be any value on it except Penny Lane & Strawberry Fields Forever which were removed under pressure to be the first 1967 single. The Get Back / Let It Be album experiment was a disaster in retrospect, so I don’t think any of the “Whites” would fit in there, nor on any album preceding Pepper. My original response was going to be “none” but I think Ringo singing “Good Night” might have worked on Abbey Road, but not as the last song.
